      • downloadFile

        public static boolean downloadFile(java.lang.String url,
                                   java.io.File to)
        Downloads a file from a URL.
        Parameters:
        url - the url
        to - the file to download to (MUST EXIST!)
        Returns:
        true only if it was successful, false otherwise

      • createFileSafely

        public static java.io.File createFileSafely(@NonNull
                                            @NonNull java.io.File file)
        This will create a file "safely". What that means is it will throw a runtime exception and return null if an error happens, it also checks if the file exists or not, and only creates it when it does not. It should only be used for files not directories!
        Parameters:
        file - the File to create
        Returns:
        the passed File

      • writeToFile

        public static void writeToFile(@NonNull
                               @NonNull java.io.File file,
                               @NonNull
                               java.lang.String... content)
        Writes the specified content to the file. Where every new element in the array is a new line.
        Parameters:
        file - the File to write to
        content - the lines

      • readFile

        public static java.lang.String readFile(@NonNull
                                        @NonNull java.io.File file)
        Reads the file and joins every row together with System.lineSeparator()
        Parameters:
        file - the File to read
        Returns:
        the content
